sponsors.name: Render
sponsors.description: Render is the fastest way to host anything online: from simple static sites to complex applications with dozens of microservices. Using Render, developers and teams can focus on building products instead of managing servers.

sponsors.name: MUX
sponsors.description: Mux is a powerful API to video and performance monitoring platform. POST a video; GET back a video URL that plays well on any device. Founded by video experts, including the creators of the biggest open-source video player (Video.js), Mux makes beautiful video possible for every development team

sponsors.name: Accedo
sponsors.description: A video solutions provider delivering premium video experiences. We offer a combination of products & services to support customers at every stage of the video business journey, from strategy & design, through to delivery & post-launch optimization

links.text: Take a closer look at our customer cases
What´s new in the OTT Industry

sponsors.name: Vercel
sponsors.description: Vercel is the best place to deploy your frontend app. Our platform enables frontend teams to do their best work. Creators of Next.js.

sponsors.name: Hasura
sponsors.description: Hasura’s open-source engine gives you instant GraphQL & REST APIs that unify your data and power modern applications

sponsors.name: Saleor
sponsors.description: Saleor’s the fastest-growing open-source, headless commerce platform. Our developer-first approach -- open-source with cloud option, GraphQL-first and Next.js ready -- helps brands like Lush deliver revolutionary frontend experiences.

sponsors.name: Snipcart
sponsors.description: Snipcart is a developer-first, low-footprint commerce platform. Its frontend is stack-agnostic, its back-office; feature-rich.

links.text: Building a Jamstack Food Ordering App

sponsors.name: NuxtJS
sponsors.description: French based company composed of remote first-class web developper passionated by the Open Source development and its community. We are focused on solving web developers issues by providing modern web solutions.

sponsors.name: Magic
sponsors.description: Magic empowers developers with tools that make passwordless auth simple, with the best user experience and long-term security built-in. With a few lines of code, no bloat, and zero unnecessary config, your app can support a variety of passwordless login methods.

sponsors.name: Netlify
sponsors.description: Used by more than 1.5M web developers & businesses, the Netlify platform provides modern build workflows, serverless functions and a global multi-cloud Edge network to deliver the most performant, secure & scalable websites & applications

links.text: Set up Strapi as a CMS for Gatsby
Build Jamstack Apps with Custom APIs

sponsors.name: Platform.sh
sponsors.description: Platform.sh is the end-to-end PaaS that enables you to build, run, and scale websites and apps in the languages and frameworks your teams need.

links.text: How to deploy Gatsby with Strapi on Platform.sh
Going headless: pulling Strapi and WordPress content during your Gatsby builds

sponsors.name: Commerce Layer
sponsors.description: A headless commerce platform and order management system that lets you add global shopping capabilities to any website, mobile app, chatbot, or IoT device, with ease. Perfect fit for the best-of-breed CMSs, static site generators, and any other tools you already master and love.

sponsors.name: MeiliSearch
sponsors.description: An open-source search engine that offers a blazingly fast search-as-you-type experience for your website or application. It is designed to deliver relevant results right out of the box, while still offering multiple options for customization & fine-tuning.

sponsors.name: Gatsby
sponsors.description: Gatsby, the modern frontend framework for React, can integrate content from Strapi with content from a broad range of sources such as traditional CMSs and commerce platforms using a rich ecosystem of 2500+ plugins to great lightning-fast, secure, beautiful web experiences for your visitors. Gatsby Cloud is the optimized end-to-end SaaS platform for developing, building, deploying, and managing your Gatsby web experiences, now with a high performance global edge network for site hosting.

sponsors.name: Algolia
sponsors.description: Algolia is a hosted search API that gives developers a complete toolkit for building search into their products. Our SaaS solution takes the pain out of building and maintaining search. We maintain the infrastructure and API clients for all important programming languages and platforms, and focus on the developer experience with extensive documentation, tooling and support.

sponsors.name: Sentry
sponsors.description: Sentry’s mission is to eliminate the havoc and potential financial loss associated with defective software by making best-in-class application monitoring available to all software teams. Sentry helps developers discover, triage, and prioritize code errors and performance bottlenecks in real time in order to deliver the best possible end-user experiences complementing your systems monitoring tools.

sponsors.name: Motiv Solutions
sponsors.description: Motiv is a consulting solutions company that specializes in optimizing business practices and future-proofing Strapi implementations to enable organizations to accelerate their digital transformation as well as speed-to-market.

sponsors.name: Ionic
sponsors.description: Ionic is a mobile app development platform for web developers, powering roughly 10% of the world’s apps. Our open source and premium tools and services help to build, secure, and deliver enterprise-grade mobile apps in less time. Ionic makes it easy to build award-winning native mobile apps and PWAs with web technologies.

sponsors.name: Cloudinary
sponsors.description: Cloudinary provides developers with powerful media API to upload, store, manage, optimize, transform and deliver images and videos. Developers utilize and easily integrate Cloudinary’s media experience platform via SDKs, widgets, add-ons into web and mobile apps built using all popular tech stacks. Cloudinary enables developers to deliver dynamic, high-performance, personalized media experiences on any device.

sponsors.name: Unlikely
sponsors.description: Unlikely is a technology studio creating bespoke digital experiences for modern brands. We combine cutting-edge technologies with great design to deliver apps that are fast, functional, and visually striking.

jobs.title: Full stack developer (Product Growth team)
jobs.description: At Strapi, we believe that everyone should have the power to create content, digital products, and user experiences that impact the world. We’re here to fuel the world’s creativity by unleashing the power of content. With the help of amazing open-source contributors, we’re on a mission to develop the most customizable CMS on the market.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.description: Accedo is a video solutions provider delivering premium video experiences. We offer a combination of products and services to support customers at every stage of the video business journey, from strategy and design, through to delivery and post-launch optimization.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer
jobs.description: At Strapi, we believe that everyone should have the power to create content, digital products, and user experiences that impact the world. We’re here to fuel the world’s creativity by unleashing the power of content. With the help of amazing open-source contributors, we’re on a mission to develop the most customizable CMS on the market.

jobs.title: Developer Relations Lead
jobs.description:
Vercel's mission is to empower front-end developers in doing their best work, at the fastest possible pace. We’re passionate about our work with that community, and we are seeking an experienced Developer Relations Leader to steward our connection to that community, grow our presence and impact, and provide a conduit for community feedback into all parts of our business.
As part of this challenging role, you will work closely with leaders and staff from across our whole business, including engineering, infrastructure, marketing, and business development.

jobs.title: Field Engineer / Solution Architect
jobs.description:
Vercel's mission is to empower front-end developers in doing their best work, at the fastest possible pace. We’re passionate about our work with that community, and we are seeking an experienced Developer Relations Leader to steward our connection to that community, grow our presence and impact, and provide a conduit for community feedback into all parts of our business.
As part of this challenging role, you will work closely with leaders and staff from across our whole business, including engineering, infrastructure, marketing, and business development.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer (Frontend)
jobs.description: Magic is an early stage, fast-growing challenger to transform the antiquated user identity space by eliminating the need for passwords, with backing from top investors such as Lightspeed Ventures, SV Angel, Social Capital, Placeholder, and Naval Ravikant. Our mission is to safeguard the trust between users and Internet services by establishing secure and authentic digital identity. Magic’s vision is an Internet of people, not credentials. We are looking for team members who are not afraid to push beyond the status quo and create the simplest, most secure, and most long-term sustainable identity solution for app developers and end-users. We would like to invite anyone who's interested in taking on the challenges of shifting the paradigm in user authentication and ending the era of passwords once and for all. We offer good compensation and sizable equity. You'll be joining a team around 15 and have a great amount of ownership in the projects at Magic. Magic is a remote-friendly company.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer (Backend)
jobs.description: Magic is an early stage, fast-growing challenger to transform the antiquated user identity space by eliminating the need for passwords, with backing from top investors such as Lightspeed Ventures, SV Angel, Social Capital, Placeholder, and Naval Ravikant. Our mission is to safeguard the trust between users and Internet services by establishing secure and authentic digital identity. Magic’s vision is an Internet of people, not credentials. We are looking for team members who are not afraid to push beyond the status quo and create the simplest, most secure, and most long-term sustainable identity solution for app developers and end-users. We would like to invite anyone who's interested in taking on the challenges of shifting the paradigm in user authentication and ending the era of passwords once and for all. We offer good compensation and sizable equity. You'll be joining a team around 15 and have a great amount of ownership in the projects at Magic. Magic is a remote-friendly company.

jobs.title: Technical Writer
jobs.description: MeiliSearch provides an extensive toolset for customization. Unlike with other search engines, these customization options are just that: optional. It works out-of-the-box with a preset that easily answers the needs of most applications. Communication is done with a RESTful API because most developers are already familiar with its norms.

speakers.bio: Robert Douglass has been deeply involved with open source software since 2004. He was the author of the first book published about Drupal, "Building Online Communities in Drupal, Wordpress, PhpBB" (Apress, 2005), is a core code contributor to 4 different Drupal versions, and the original author of the Memcache and Solr modules for Drupal. Robert has also served as a member of the Drupal Association, a founding member of the German Drupal Association, and a member of the Drupal Security team. As a cloud hosting specialist he designed the server architecture for 100s of high profile sites, and is currently the VP Channel Sales for Platform.sh. Beyond technology, Robert works as a record producer, photographer, and is frequently a speaker advocating for free software and free culture ideals in the music industry.
speakers.name: Robert Douglass
speakers.title: Chief DevRel Officer

speakers.bio: Rohit is a Customer Solutions Engineer at Sentry. Prior to joining Sentry, Rohit held DevOps and Release Engineering roles at IoT, Retail & E-commerce, and Telecommunications companies.
speakers.name: Rohit Kataria
speakers.title: Customer Solutions Engineer

speakers.bio: Bolaji is a Software Engineer, Content Creator, and Community Engineer who currently works as a Developer Advocate at Commerce Layer. He's passionate about sharing knowledge, documentation, web engineering, Jamstack, headless commerce, communities and FOSS
speakers.name: Bolaji Ayodeji
speakers.title: Developer Advocate

speakers.bio: Roy Derks is a serial startup CTO, developer, author and conference speaker from Amsterdam. He has founded multiple e-commerce and marketplace startups in the past, and is now working with Saleor as an ambassador.
speakers.name: Roy Derks
speakers.title: Ambassador

speakers.bio: Mom since 2017 and Strapi user's since 2018. I'm fully loving on R&D, Infra & Web development. I'm currently CTO of RiderClub.fr (1st sharing motorcycle service in France).
speakers.name: Vanessa	Pasqué
speakers.title: CTO

speakers.bio: Scott Agirs' is an entrepreneur-turned software engineer. Having built and sold his first website at the early age of 14, software development has always been a part of his life. Last few years with full-steam and Strapi in his tool belt his helping early-stage JavaScript-built startups to get off the ground.
speakers.name: Scott Agirs Neminskis
speakers.title: Full Stack Developer

speakers.bio: Chad Carlson is a DevRel Engineer at Platform.sh, and during that time he has worked with Strapi quite a bit during his time documenting Node.js support and decoupled websites. He's interested in when decoupling is the right choice for teams (and when), and if he's not teaching himself a new programming language he can usually be found writing or cooking something or other.
speakers.name: Chad Carlson
speakers.title: DevRel Engineer

speakers.bio: Over 14 yers in web development, starting from table layout and IE6 till today. Working mostly as a frontend developer in e-commerce industry and running side project on WordPress. Last few years change development environment and focus mainly on JAM, MERN, ... stack. Also interested in IOT technology by doing small house automation projects as a hobby.
speakers.name: Stanislav	Mihić
speakers.title: Senior Software Engineer

speakers.bio: Engineering Manager & Principal Engineer @ VirtusLab who is building and leading teams for projects of various scale. A Full Stack Developer from origin and passion, for whom the concept of 'business day' does not apply, because passion is can't be limited. Founder & organizer of Krakow TypeScript User Group (KTUG) meetup, meet.js & conferences speaker.
speakers.name: Mateusz Ziarko
speakers.title: Engineering Manager & Principal Engineer

speakers.bio: Alex is the engineering lead at Strapi. He leads the development of technology for the company. He is also passionate about pastry making and likes helping people build innovative products.
speakers.name: Alexandre Bodin
speakers.title: Engineering Lead

speakers.bio: He’s a product builder, CPO & co-founder at Strapi. He has been a huge fan of CMSs since he’s 15 years old when he developed his first CMS. He likes playing basketball and board games, especially Catan.
speakers.name: Aurélien Georget
speakers.title: Co-founder, CPO

speakers.bio: Developer Advocate for Magic.link by day, Multi-Passionate Gal who loves to film, build, write, draw, sew, and a bunch of other fun artsy things by night.
speakers.name: Maricris Bonzo
speakers.title: Developer Advocate

speakers.bio: A female Nigerian with a Bachelor's degree in Marine engineering and Bootcamp certificates in Software development. She is also a full stack JavaScript developer (MEVN) stack and loves to share knowledge about her transition from marine engineering to software development to encourage people who love software development and don't know where to begin. She also contribute to FOSS in her free time.
speakers.name: Ukpai Ugochi
speakers.title: Freelance technical writer

speakers.bio: Kati Frantz is a software engineer and Auth0 Ambassador passionate about mentoring and training other developers. He’s published over 150 hours of training resources on Udemy with over 65 000 students.  He’s worked with multiple teams and startups across the world to build powerful, modern, performant and scalable web applications. He is also a speaker and author of the Deploying Nodejs book. He is currently the core maintainer of the open-source headless CMS and API builder Tenseijs.
speakers.name: Kati	Frantz

speakers.bio: Pierre is the co-founder and CEO of Strapi. Frustrated by the limitations of traditional CMS while working as a freelance developer, he co-founded, with Aurélien Georget and Jim Laurie, Strapi, the leading open-source Headless CMS. He is a lover of Node.js and APIs, and when not coding, it’s likely he will be windsurfing.
speakers.name: Pierre Burgy
speakers.title: CEO

speakers.bio:
Heiko Voigt is working as a full-stack javascript web developer for SIT GmbH in Germany and Harbour Light Software Development Ltd. in Canada. 
As a core member of the Cross Canada Collaboration User Group (C3UG) and an HCL Ambassador 2021, he is working in the field of HCL digital solutions software for more than 25 years. He is also a passionate home brewer and a proud father of twin girls.
speakers.name: Heiko Voigt
speakers.title: CEO

speakers.bio: Alexander Lichter is a Nuxt.js maintainer and web development consultant in his twenties. When not working on open-source projects, he gives talks and workshops, writes blog posts or helps other companies with regards to web development, mainly focussing on Vue.js and Nuxt.js.
speakers.name: Alexander Lichter
speakers.title: Web Dev Consultant

speakers.bio: I'm a software engineer from Brussels, Belgium. I work on dev tools that help developers use MeiliSearch. I love back-end JavaScript and all types of databases.
speakers.name: Charlotte Vermandel
speakers.title: Software Engineer

speakers.bio:
Liz is a community-taught Software Engineer focused on JavaScript, and Head of Developer Relations at NodeSource. She organizes different community events such as JSConf Colombia, Pioneras Developers, Startup Weekend and has been a speaker at EmpireJS, MedellinJS, PionerasDev, and Node+JS Interactive.

She loves sharing knowledge, promoting JavaScript and Node.js ecosystem and participating in key tech events and conferences to enhance her knowledge and network.
speakers.name: Liz Parody
speakers.title: Head of Developers Relations

speakers.bio: Sam Bhagwat is Gatsby's Co-founder and Chief Strategy Officer. He's the author of Journey to the Content Mesh, a series outlining the modernization and modularization of the website technology stack.
speakers.name: Sam Bhagwat
speakers.title: Cofounder and CSO

speakers.bio: Chris Sev is the founder of scotch.io and a Senior Developer Advocate at DigitalOcean. He puts his focus on building simple and clean SaaS experiences for customers.
speakers.name: Chris Sev
speakers.title: Sr Developer Advocate

speakers.bio: Praveen is a Developer Advocate at Hasura. He is a tech enthusiast, passionate about improving developer experience and advocates for usage of GraphQL, React and Serverless.
speakers.name: Praveen D
speakers.title: Developer Advocate

speakers.bio:
Melissa is a seasoned front-end developer with more than a decade of experience. She loves learning and working with new technologies. Melissa appreciates the ease and convenience that a headless CMS provides by allowing content to come from one source. 

When Melissa isn’t singing her praises to new tech, she enjoys literal singing and a good cup of coffee!
speakers.name: Melissa Garr
speakers.title: Frontend developer

speakers.bio: Rudy Weber discovered the world of programming at 14 years old and decided from then on to spend the majority of his teenage years in his bedroom in front of the computer. As a consultant, Rudy has worked on a wide spectrum of projects, from international corporations' public-facing applications to the development of a programming language. Convinced that knowledge is only worth acquiring if shared, he started teaching about his learnings in the industry to whoever was willing to listen. Accordingly, Rudy is now a Developer Relations Engineer at Platform.sh, specializing in JavaScript.
speakers.name: Rudy Weber
speakers.title: DevRel Engineer

speakers.bio: Vladimir works as a software engineer at Sqreen where he builds a tool to secure web applications. He used to be a professional security auditor and a web developer in agencies. He is part of the Node.js Security Working Group where he handles the security of Node.js. Vladimir also often give talks and training to software engineers to teach them about application security. He has been speaking at OWASP conferences (California and Europe), Node Summit, NodeConf (NL and Colombia) and Node+JS Interactive.
speakers.name: Vladimir	de Turckheim
speakers.title: Customer Engineering Team Lead

speakers.bio:
François builds, learns, and laughs in beautiful Québec City. He's CEO at Snipcart, an e-commerce solution for developers. He's also a board member and mentor at Apollo13, a startup program he helped launch. A marketer by trade, he was responsible for building Snipcart's initial growth machine, which runs on good content, community, and SEO. His writing has been featured on Indie Hackers, The Startup, freeCodeCamp, Baremetrics, and more publications.
Since joining Snipcart, he gave startup and e-commerce presentations in 14+ events all over the world (Canada, USA, France, Ireland). He worked remotely from half a dozen different countries in his first years on the market.
speakers.name: Francois Lanthier Nadeau
speakers.title: CEO

speakers.bio: A front-end developer with vast experience handling different projects from corporate websites to full e-commerce platforms. She's also been working on Strapi's website for almost a year, making the CMS (coupled with React) one of her everyday tools, and she's loving it!
speakers.name: Marion Ott
speakers.title: Front-end developer

speakers.bio: IT Project Manager with over 5 years of experience in Project Management and Change Management in the Information Technology and Hotel industry
speakers.name: Arlene Zavala
speakers.title: IT Project Manager

speakers.bio: Before starting Vercel (formerly ZEIT) in November 2015, Guillermo was the CTO and co-founder of LearnBoost and Cloudup, acquired by Automattic in 2013. He's the creator of several popular Node.js open source libraries like Socket.io, Mongoose and Slackin. Prior to Node.js, he was a core developer of the MooTools frontend toolkit. He is determined to make the web better.
speakers.name: Guillermo Rauch
speakers.title: CEO

speakers.bio: Jim is the Chief User Success Officer at Strapi. By being an expert of the project and close to the community and their usage/needs, he is in charge of making sure we provide all resources that will set Strapi users up for success.
speakers.name: Jim Laurie
speakers.title: Co-Founder & Chief User Success Officer

speakers.bio: Anisha is a Front-end Developer at IBM, she has been there for 3 years. Anisha is passionate about promoting diversity, React and coffee!
speakers.name: Anisha Malde
speakers.title: Developer

speakers.bio: Ekene is a Developer Experience Engineer at Netlify. When he's not working and doing Jamstacky things, he likes teaching and learning new things.
speakers.name: Ekene Eze
speakers.title: Developer Experience Engineer

speakers.bio: Bart Witteveen is the Lead Developer and Architect of Smartshore Ability. He has been the man who introduced Strapi within our team!
speakers.name: Bart	Witteveen
speakers.title: Architect

speakers.bio: Brent is a technical professional and hobbyist.  Bottom line, Brent loves learning and using new tech to solve problems.  With more years of technical experience than he would care to admit, he helped start Motiv Solutions to help customers accomplish their desired business outcomes.
speakers.name: Brent Griffin
speakers.title: Chief Strategy Officer

speakers.bio: Tamas is a Google Developer Expert in Web Technologies and a Developer Experience Engineer. He has more than a decade of experience delivering technical training to large, prestigious organisations. He is passionate about unlocking the latest & greatest features of web development.
speakers.name: Tamas Piros
speakers.title: Developer Experience Engineer

talks.title: Enriching Commerce Data In Headless Architectures
talks.description: Headless Commerce APIs give you the same flexibility and scalability as you can expect from a Headless CMS. Where e-commerce platforms are designed to work with product data and checkout systems, the latter is best suited to manage rich web content for the rest of your website. To keep this separation of concern, you combine these two headless architectures! In this talk I'll show how to use the headless Saleor Commerce and enrich that data by combining it with Strapi CMS.

talks.title: Strapi as a publishing platform for the largest local sports betting platform
talks.description: Strapi as a publishing platform for our marketing team tool arsenal with the possibility to manage and deliver content to our players without limitations in mind with feature use.

talks.title: Hasura Workshop: Build a powerful fullstack app for JAMStack with Hasura and Strapi
talks.description:
In this workshop, you will be building a powerful application backend with role based authorization using Hasura. Strapi's GraphQL API will be used as a remote data source to generate a unified GraphQL API in Hasura

Prerequisites:
Familiarity with GraphQL is preferred 

Skill level:
Intermediate

talks.title: How to Jamstack in a dynamic era
talks.description:
There’s a general misconception that since Jamstack sites and applications don't rely on traditional server architectures, they come at the cost of dynamic, powerful experiences. The reality is, Jamstack sites are great for creating highly dynamic, interactions using powerful tools like serverless functions and a variety of third-party services.

In this session, we'll look at how a Jamstack architecture, with serverless functions and Strapi CMS, help developers deliver scale, performance, and a rich content authoring experience, without the burden of servers or infrastructure to maintain"

talks.title: Top 10 Strapi Tips
talks.description:
In this talk, we will go through 10 tips that will cover almost every aspect of a Strapi project.
This will help you understand how Strapi works behind the hood by reviewing some specific use-cases.

talks.title: Headless Commerce done right, with Commerce Layer
talks.description: Digital commerce has changed, and there is an increasing demand for faster and kite efficient solutions. More technologies are arising, more online stores are erupting, and customers make purchases on more devices. In this talk, Bolaji will introduce you to the challenges with traditional commerce, how headless commerce solves those challenges, and how Commerce Layer supercharges your digital experiences.

talks.title: Jammin on Strapi
talks.description: In this talk, we'll build a Jamstack site with Strapi and Next.js all in 25 minutes. It will have static and dynamic components and be blazing fast.

talks.title: 0 to Production in 60 days
talks.description: 0 to Production in 4 sprints sounds like the title to a horror movie but it was the reality Covid created. As a response to the current situation we were tasked with building a showcase platform for the students of UAL to upload and display their work for the world to see. I want to take you through the journey I had and how Strapi made it possible.

talks.title: Content-Types Builder 101
talks.description: Deep dive into how to configure Strapi Content-Types Builder to recreate the Strapi.io navigation and universal pages.

talks.title: Cloudinary Workshop: Strapi 101 - The Fundamentals
talks.description:
Are you new to Strapi? This workshop covers all the basics to get you started with this headless CMS. Throughout the workshop 			we'll build a basic application that will consume data from Strapi.

Prerequisites:
web development knowledge, JS knowledge

Skill level:
basic

talks.title: Best Practices For Gatsby + Strapi
talks.description: In this talk, Sam will give some examples on how you can use Gatsby & Strapi together, why Gatsby is a great match for Strapi (and vice versa), and then he will dive into some example demo code of use cases.

talks.title: Integrate open-source search into your Strapi project
talks.description: I will present the problematics of in-app search with a quick recap of the state of search today. Then I will introduce MeiliSearch as a solution and explain how it solves the problems mentioned before. Finally, I will show through a demonstration how to use it simply with Strapi collections using the plugin we created.

talks.title: Gather More Meaningfully with Strapi and Magic
talks.description: An insightful tutorial on how I built an events page where users could sign up and RSVP to upcoming gatherings that were consciously-crafted. The events management system is powered by Strapi, while secure user authentication is made possible with the Magic plugin.

talks.title: Using strapi, Node-Red and Ionic to build a weather alarm app for the ministry of agriculture in Rhineland-Palatine, Germany
talks.description: In this session, we will show you how to integrate strapi, Node-Red and ionic to build a full stack javascript application for personalized weather warnings.

talks.title: Creating a notification plugin for Expo with Strapi
talks.description: In this talk, we'll look at how a simple idea, and need, can be real in few days by using Strapi to implement a notification system. We'll get into how to use Expo Notification to send notification to your mobile application (using Expo), taking a look into the plugin I built and the many Strapi features in implements, and showing you how to use it with any Strapi project.

talks.title: Creating a new media newspaper platform
talks.description:
As Strapi partner, Smartshore Ability (The Netherlands) implemented the new website for RD (https://www.rd.nl/). RD is the biggest Dutch religious newspaper and exists in both digital and physical formats. 
So in this talk, we will present the project, why we chose Strapi, the architecture of the project as well the challenges we ran into. Where did Strapi fail and what solutions did Smartshore Ability have to develop to overcome these challenges?

talks.title: A bit of Web Application Security
talks.description: It's dangerous to go alone! Running a web application can be scary if you don't have experience in attacking and securing them. In this talk, we will go through principles of Web Application security and how they can impact a Strapi production.

talks.title: Effective caching strategies for a faster JAMstack
talks.description: JAMstack was born from a great desire for more performant web applications. As your applications grow, your caching strategies need to adapt to the ever-changing needs of your web application. Using the right caching strategy for the right type of web application is critical to experience the full benefits of the JAMstack. Come along with me on this journey to master the best practices and strategies to caching your JAMstack applications in a modern era.

talks.title: Content Modeling Best Practices
talks.description:
Content modeling is one of Strapi's modeling type.
In content type modelling, the user creates a JSON file that represents how data will be structured in the data base and a set of lifecycle hooks in javascript file that determines how and when data should be called into their web application.

With the lifecycle hook in place, content type data structures can only be used for one API’s model. "

talks.title: Wise approach for community & commercial Strapi plugins development
talks.description: Typically there are no tradeoffs, we have to choose if we’re engaging into the community or just focus on delivering commercial business value for our clients using open source. How to manage it wisely?

talks.title: Strapi + Nuxt.js + Composition Api = ❤️
talks.description:
Nuxt.js - the intuitive framework built on top of Vue - is the perfect fit for Strapi, especially when it comes to Jamstack.
In this session, we will build the fitting frontend for our Strapi CMS by leveraging the Composition API and ensure it is performant and fast.
Get insights into the world of Vue and Nuxt, useful patterns for the Composition API and possibly some sneak peaks

talks.title: The state of modern e-commerce
talks.description:
Modern e-commerce is a beautiful mess. Let's unscramble it. In this session, Snipcart CEO Francois Lanthier Nadeau will explore:

1. Technical paradigms overview: monolithic, Jamstack, and headless commerce
2. The fragmentation of e-commerce functionality
3. The explosion of e-commerce offering: new solutions categories
4. How to pick your e-commerce stack

•No prerequisites 
•Skills level: beginner

talks.title: Keynote
talks.description: StrapiConf Keynote featuring Strapi co-founders, CTO, well-known speaker from the JAMstack ecosystem as well as top Strapi users and customers.

talks.title: Boosting Productivity and Team Velocity with Strapi
talks.description: Enhance your team's velocity and take productivity to the next level.

talks.title: Extending your Strapi app with lifecycle hooks, controllers and services
talks.description: A quick introduction to the most useful tools for extending your Strapi app's functionality. We will slugify a blog post with a lifecycle method, attach an author to it in the controller and see an example of how a Service can be used.

talks.title: Motiv Solutions Workshop: Moving Content Between Multiple Strapi Environments
Examining Observability in Node.js using Strapi
talks.description:
Observability is important to learn what’s happening in your app to stay competitive and create the most performant and efficient applications, following the best practices.

In this talk, we will explore useful tools to examine observability in your applications and how it will speed up development, produce better code while improving reliability and uptime. Don’t miss it!

talks.title: Editorial workflows, GIT them here!
talks.description:
How do we reconcile the differences between the needs of our developers and those of our content creation teams? Have you ever run into an editorial team who just doesn’t want to get their hands dirty with Git? There’s plenty of them. Strapi’s fantastic for giving them an interface to organize content to be consumed by frontends, but many of their needs work directly against Git-centric development workflows (aka GitOps) we see today.
 
In this talk, we’ll cover how Strapi can be deployed alongside a frontend consuming application on a single project on Platform.sh. From there, we’ll slowly piece together two parallel workflows for teams with very different needs in mind:
- Editorial: don’t touch Git. Live content previews. Runtime collection creation that moves to master. 
- Development: Git as the source of truth, repeatable builds, isolated environments, Infrastructure-as-code.

talks.title: Platform.sh Workshop: Build a production Strapi instance service by service with Platform.sh
talks.description: Strapi is a tremendous tool for quickly building content APIs, but building a local app into a production site comes with all the same concerns any other site has. Primarily, you need to be able to quickly and repeatedly provision infrastructure for new features and each new pull request to the application. In this workshop, we’ll show you how the infrastructure-as-code approach of Platform.sh can offload all of your infrastructure needs directly onto Git by adding multiple service containers with just a few lines of YAML,  providing you with an efficient development workflow as you build out your production headless CMS.

talks.title: Sentry Workshop: Pinpoint slowness, catch errors and gauge health of your app’s releases.
talks.description:
Check off your monitoring needs with an in-depth walkthrough of Sentry’s latest features to help you catch errors, track slowness and get ahead of session crashes in your app.
In this workshop, you’ll learn how Sentry employs a See-Solve-Learn approach curated for Product Owners, SREs, QEs and our Developers.

Prerequisites:
Basic knowledge of Software Development

Skill level:
All
